name: Senator Pat Toomey
tweet: Congress can act to make our communities safer. The Manchin-Toomey bill to expand background checks to all commercial firearm sales is a good place to start. I stand ready to work with any member of Congress and @RealDonaldTrump to make this happen.

name: Senator Pat Toomey
tweet: In 2012, a domestic abuser shot & killed 3 women in Brookfield, WI, including his wife. He wounded 4 others, including a pregnant woman. The shooter, who bought the gun online w/o a background check, was prohibited from having a gun b/c of a domestic violence restraining order.

name: Senator Pat Toomey
tweet: In 2014, a convicted felon shot & killed 4 people in Monongalia Co., WV, including his ex-girlfriend & her boyfriend. The shooter, who bought the gun online w/o a background check, was prohibited from having a gun b/c of a felony kidnapping conviction.

name: Senator Pat Toomey
tweet: In 2015, a convicted felon shot & killed 8 people in Harris Co., TX: his ex-girlfriend, her husband & her 6 children. The shooter, who bought the gun online w/o a background check, was prohibited from having a gun b/c he was a convicted felon who’d spent nearly 12 yrs in prison.

name: Senator Pat Toomey
tweet: There’s no logical reason why you must have a background check to buy from a retailer, but not online or at a gun show. The Manchin-Toomey background check bill will save lives. Had it been law, these mass shootings may never have occurred:

tweet: I have spoken w/ the president directly and my staff and I have talked with the White House regularly over the past 2 weeks about extending background checks to cover all commercial firearm sales to keep guns out of the hands of violent criminals and the dangerously mentally ill.
